page.title: 12FARMING 2
page.content: Quite alot of the farmers own chickens and ducks to sell or keep for themselves. Some farmers set aside about half an acre for nature sometimes with rare plants to make it a{mini nature reserve.}A couple of farmers{rent out cottages or houses for people to live or have a holiday in. They then get some extra money to help pay for things on the farm. Most farmers go to{market on Wednesday}to buy or sell.{Newton Abbot market}is quite famous. Many farmers buy calves or other animals for a price of twenty pounds, fatten them up and sell them as bigger{calves}or fully grown{cattle for the price of sixty to ninety pounds so they can get alot of{profit.
